intro: Withania macrocalyx, commonly known as the Indian winter cherry, is a herbaceous plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other notable plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant features yellow flowers and produces red, fleshy berries that contain small, hard seeds. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its botanical characteristics make it an interesting subject for both ecological and medicinal studies.
